requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI directory and file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI directory and file ownership is set to root:root.

requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI certificate file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that Kubernetes PKI certificate files have permissions of 644 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI key file permissions are set to 600
requirement_description: Ensure that Kubernetes PKI key files have permissions of 600.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --basic-auth-file argument is not set
requirement_description: Do not use basic authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --token-auth-file parameter is not set
requirement_description: Do not use token based authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubelet-https argument is set to true
requirement_description: Use https for kubelet connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: Enable certificate based kubelet authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
requirement_description: Do not always authorize all requests.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes Node
requirement_description: Restrict kubelet nodes to reading only objects associated with them.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC
requirement_description: Turn on Role Based Access Control.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set
requirement_description: Limit the rate at which the API server accepts requests.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysAdmit is not set
requirement_description: Do not allow all requests.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set
requirement_description: Always pull images.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used
requirement_description: The SecurityContextDeny admission controller can be used to deny pods which make use of some SecurityContext fields which could allow for privilege escalation in the cluster. This should be used where PodSecurityPolicy is not in place within the cluster.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set
requirement_description: Automate service accounts management.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set
requirement_description: Reject creating objects in a namespace that is undergoing termination.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin PodSecurityPolicy is set
requirement_description: Reject creating pods that do not match Pod Security Policies.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set
requirement_description: Limit the Node and Pod objects that a kubelet could modify.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --insecure-bind-address argument is not set
requirement_description: Do not bind the insecure API service.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --insecure-port argument is set to 0
requirement_description: Do not bind to insecure port.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --secure-port argument is not set to 0
requirement_description: Do not disable the secure port.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-path argument is set
requirement_description: Enable auditing on the Kubernetes API Server and set the desired audit log path.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxage argument is set to 30 or as appropriate
requirement_description: Retain the logs for at least 30 days or as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxbackup argument is set to 10 or as appropriate
requirement_description: Retain 10 or an appropriate number of old log files.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxsize argument is set to 100 or as appropriate
requirement_description: Rotate log files on reaching 100 MB or as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --request-timeout argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Set global request timeout for API server requests as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --service-account-lookup argument is set to true
requirement_description: Validate service account before validating token.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --service-account-key-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Explicitly set a service account public key file for service accounts on the apiserver.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --etcd-certfile and --etcd-keyfile arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --etcd-cafile argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --encryption-provider-config argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Encrypt etcd key-value store.

requirement_name: Ensure that encryption providers are appropriately configured
requirement_description: Where etcd encryption is used, appropriate providers should be configured.

requirement_name: Ensure that the API Server only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers
requirement_description: Ensure that the API server is configured to only use strong cryptographic ciphers.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --terminated-pod-gc-threshold argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Activate garbage collector on pod termination, as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --use-service-account-credentials argument is set to true
requirement_description: Use individual service account credentials for each controller.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --service-account-private-key-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Explicitly set a service account private key file for service accounts on the controller manager.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Allow pods to verify the API server's serving certificate before establishing connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
requirement_description: Do not bind the Controller Manager service to non-loopback insecure addresses.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
requirement_description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses.

requirement_name: Ensure that ActionTrail are configured to export copies of all Log entries
requirement_description: ActionTrail is a web service that records API calls for your account and delivers log files to you. The recorded information includes the identity of the API caller, the time of the API call, the source IP address of the API caller, the request parameters, and the response elements returned by the Alibaba Cloud service. ActionTrail provides a history of API calls for an account, including API calls made via the Management Console, SDKs, command line tools.

requirement_name: Ensure the OSS used to store ActionTrail logs is not publicly accessible
requirement_description: ActionTrail logs a record of every API call made in your Alibaba Cloud account. These logs file are stored in an OSS bucket. It is recommended that the access control list (ACL) of the OSS bucket, which ActionTrail logs to, shall prevent public access to the ActionTrail logs.

requirement_name: Ensure audit logs for multiple cloud resources are integrated with Log Service
requirement_description: Log Service provides functions of log collection and analysis in real time across multiple cloud resources under the authorized resource owners. This enable the large-scale corporate for security governance over all resources owned by multiple accounts by integrating the log from different sources and monitoring. For example, Log Service supports the integration to collect logs from the following sources:  ActionTrail is a cloud service that records API calls made in a given Alibaba Cloud account.  ApsaraDB RDS and DRDS audit records all data manipulation language (DML) and data definition language (DDL) operations through network protocol analysis and only consumes a small amount of CPU resources. The Trial Edition of SQL Explorer retains SQL log data generated within up to one day free of charge.  Object Storage Service (OSS) support recording every changes to its resources including bucket, ACL, replications, and files, as well as file access logs.  The access log feature of SLB can be applied to HTTP- and HTTPS-based Layer 7 load balancing. Access logs can contain about 30 fields such as the time when a request is received, the IP address of the client, processing latency, request URI, backend server (ECS instance) address, and returned status code. As an Internet access point, SLB needs to distribute a large number of access requests.  Alibaba Cloud API Gateway provides API hosting service to facilitate micro- service aggregation, frontend and backend isolation, and system integration. Each API request corresponds to an access record, which contains information such as the IP address of the API caller, requested URL, response latency, returned status code, and number of bytes for each request and response. With the preceding information, you can understand the operating status of your web services.  NAS audit and access log support to record each request to Network File System (NFS) file system including file changes and access, details of the access request, such as the operation type, target object, and response status of the current user. Log Service also provides rich functions such as real-time query and analysis, and dashboard presentation for this part of logs.

requirement_name: Ensure Log Service is enabled for Container Service for Kubernetes
requirement_description: Log Service shall be connected with Kubernetes clusters of Alibaba Cloud Container Service to collect the audit log for central monitoring and analysis. You can simply enable Log Service when creating a cluster for log collection.

requirement_name: Ensure virtual network flow log service is enabled
requirement_description: The flow log can be used to capture the traffic of an Elastic Network Interface (ENI), Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) or Virtual Switch (VSwitch). The flow log of a VPC or VSwitch shall be integrated with Log Service to capture the traffic of all ENIs in the VPC or VSwtich including the ENIs created after the flow log function is enabled. The traffic data captured by flow logs is stored in Log Service for real-time monitoring and analysis. A capture window is about 10 minutes, during which the traffic data is aggregated and then released to flow log record.

requirement_name: Ensure Anti-DDoS access and security log service is enabled
requirement_description: Alibaba Cloud Anti-DDoS Pro supports integration with Log Service for website access log (including HTTP flood attack logs) to enable the real-time analysis and reporting center features. The log collected can be monitored on a central dashboard on Log Service.

requirement_name: Ensure Web Application Firewall access and security log service is enabled
requirement_description: Log Service collects log entries that record visits to and attacks on websites that are protected by Alibaba Cloud Web Application Firewall (WAF), and supports real-time log query and analysis. The query results are centrally displayed in dashboards.

requirement_name: Ensure that the audit policy covers key security concerns
requirement_description: Ensure that the audit policy created for the cluster covers key security concerns.

requirement_name: Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet service file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root.

requirement_name: If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
requirement_description: If kube-proxy is running, and if it is using a file-based kubeconfig file, ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: If kube-proxy is running, ensure that the file ownership of its kubeconfig file is set to root:root.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root.

requirement_name: Ensure that the certificate authorities file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root.

requirement_name: Ensure that the kubelet --config configuration file has permissions set to 644 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the kubelet --config configuration file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file is owned by root:root.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable anonymous requests to the Kubelet server.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
requirement_description: Do not allow all requests. Enable explicit authorization.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Enable Kubelet authentication using certificates.

requirement_name: Verify that the --read-only-port argument is set to 0
requirement_description: Disable the read-only port.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --streaming-connection-idle-timeout argument is not set to 0
requirement_description: Do not disable timeouts on streaming connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --protect-kernel-defaults argument is set to true
requirement_description: Protect tuned kernel parameters from overriding kubelet default kernel parameter values.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --make-iptables-util-chains argument is set to true
requirement_description: Allow Kubelet to manage iptables.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --event-qps argument is set to 0 or a level which ensures appropriate event capture
requirement_description: Security relevant information should be captured. The --event-qps flag on the Kubelet can be used to limit the rate at which events are gathered. Setting this too low could result in relevant events not being logged, however the unlimited setting of 0 could result in a denial of service on the kubelet.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: Setup TLS connection on the Kubelets.

requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubelet only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers
requirement_description: The RBAC role cluster-admin provides wide-ranging powers over the environment and should be used only where and when needed.

requirement_name: Minimize access to secrets
requirement_description: The Kubernetes API stores secrets, which may be service account tokens for the Kubernetes API or credentials used by workloads in the cluster. Access to these secrets should be restricted to the smallest possible group of users to reduce the risk of privilege escalation.

requirement_name: Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles
requirement_description: Kubernetes Roles and ClusterRoles provide access to resources based on sets of objects and actions that can be taken on those objects. It is possible to set either of these to be the wildcard "*" which matches all items. Use of wildcards is not optimal from a security perspective as it may allow for inadvertent access to be granted when new resources are added to the Kubernetes API either as CRDs or in later versions of the product.

requirement_name: Minimize access to create pods
requirement_description: The ability to create pods in a namespace can provide a number of opportunities for privilege escalation, such as assigning privileged service accounts to these pods or mounting hostPaths with access to sensitive data (unless Pod Security Policies are implemented to restrict this access) As such, access to create new pods should be restricted to the smallest possible group of users.

requirement_name: Ensure that default service accounts are not actively used.
requirement_description: The default service account should not be used to ensure that rights granted to applications can be more easily audited and reviewed.

requirement_name: Ensure that Service Account Tokens are only mounted where necessary
requirement_description: Service accounts tokens should not be mounted in pods except where the workload running in the pod explicitly needs to communicate with the API server

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of privileged containers
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the securityContext.privileged flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostPID flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host IPC namespace
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostIPC flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host network namespace
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostNetwork flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the allowPrivilegeEscalation flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of root containers
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run as the root user.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with the NET_RAW capability
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers with the potentially dangerous NET_RAW capability.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with added capabilities
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers with capabilities assigned beyond the default set.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned
requirement_description: There are a variety of CNI plugins available for Kubernetes. If the CNI in use does not support Network Policies it may not be possible to effectively restrict traffic in the cluster.

requirement_name: Ensure that all Namespaces have Network Policies defined
requirement_description: Kubernetes supports mounting secrets as data volumes or as environment variables. Minimize the use of environment variable secrets.

requirement_name: Consider external secret storage
requirement_description: Configure Image Provenance for your deployment.

requirement_name: Create administrative boundaries between resources using namespaces
requirement_description: Use namespaces to isolate your Kubernetes objects.

requirement_name: Ensure that the seccomp profile is set to runtime/default in your pod definitions
requirement_description: Enable runtime/default seccomp profile in your pod definitions.

requirement_name: Apply Security Context to Your Pods and Containers
requirement_description: Apply Security Context to Your Pods and Containers

requirement_name: The default namespace should not be used
requirement_description: Kubernetes provides a default namespace, where objects are placed if no namespace is specified for them. Placing objects in this namespace makes application of RBAC and other controls more difficult.

requirement_name: Ensure Image Vulnerability Scanning using ACR image scanning or a third party provider
requirement_description: Scan images stored in Alibaba Cloud Container Registry (ACR) for vulnerabilities.

requirement_name: Minimize user access to ACR
requirement_description: Restrict user access to ACR, limiting interaction with build images to only authorized personnel and service accounts.

requirement_name: Minimize cluster access to read-only for ACR
requirement_description: Configure the Cluster Service Account with Storage Object Viewer Role to only allow read- only access to ACR.

requirement_name: Minimize Container Registries to only those approved
requirement_description: Use approved container registries.

requirement_name: Ensure Kubernetes Secrets are encrypted using keys managed in KMS
requirement_description: Encrypt Kubernetes secrets, stored in etcd, at the application-layer using a customer- managed key in Cloud KMS.

requirement_name: Restrict Access to the Control Plane Endpoint
requirement_description: Enable Endpoint Private Access to restrict access to the cluster's control plane to only an allowlist of authorized IPs.

requirement_name: Ensure clusters are created with Private Endpoint Enabled and Public Access Disabled
requirement_description: Disable access to the Kubernetes API from outside the node network if it is not required.

requirement_name: Ensure clusters are created with Private Nodes
requirement_description: Disable public IP addresses for cluster nodes, so that they only have private IP addresses. Private Nodes are nodes with no public IP addresses.

requirement_name: Ensure Network Policy is Enabled and set as appropriate
requirement_description: Use Network Policy to restrict pod to pod traffic within a cluster and segregate workloads.

requirement_name: Encrypt traffic to HTTPS load balancers with TLS certificates
requirement_description: Encrypt traffic to HTTPS load balancers using TLS certificates.

requirement_name: Enable data disk encryption for Alibaba Cloud Disks
requirement_description: Use Customer-Managed Encryption Keys (CMEK) to encrypt the Aliaba Cloud Disk and attached it as data disk in ACK cluster.

requirement_name: Ensure Cluster Auditing is Enabled
requirement_description: Send cluster audit logs to a remote aggregator to mitigate the risk of local tampering in the event of a breach.

requirement_name: Ensure Pod Security Policy is Enabled and set as appropriate
requirement_description: Pod Security Policy should be used to prevent privileged containers where possible and enforce namespace and workload configurations.

requirement_name: Enable Cloud Security Center
requirement_description: Enable Cloud Security Center to provide a centralized view of security for your ACK clusters.

requirement_name: Consider ACK Sandboxed-Container for running untrusted workloads
requirement_description: Use ACK Sandboxed-Container to restrict untrusted workloads as an additional layer of protection when running in a multi-tenant environment.

requirement_name: Consider ACK TEE-based when running confidential computing
requirement_description: ACK provides TEE-based confidential computing. This is a cloud-native and all-in-one solution based on Intel Software Guard Extensions (SGX). It aims to deliver and manage trusted applications and confidential computing applications by ensuring the security, integrity, and confidentiality of data in use.

requirement_name: Consider use service account token volume projection
requirement_description: Use service account token volume projection to enhance security when you use service accounts.

requirement_name: Ensure no root account access key exists
requirement_description: Access keys provide programmatic access to a given Alibaba Cloud account. It is recommended that all access keys associated with the root account be removed.

requirement_name: Ensure MFA is enabled for the "root" account
requirement_description: With MFA enabled, anytime the root account logs on to Alibaba Cloud, it will be prompted for username and password followed by an authentication code from the virtual MFA device. It is recommended that MFA be enabled for the root user.

requirement_name: Ensure that multi-factor authentication is enabled for all RAM users that have a console password
requirement_description: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of protection on top of a username and password. With MFA enabled, when a user logs on to Alibaba Cloud, they will be prompted for their user name and password followed by an authentication code from their virtual MFA device. It is recommended that MFA be enabled for all users that have a console password.

requirement_name: Ensure users not logged on for 90 days or longer are disabled for console logon
requirement_description: Alibaba Cloud RAM users can logon to Alibaba Cloud console by using their user name and password. If a user has not logged on for 90 days or longer, it is recommended to disable the console access of the user.

requirement_name: Ensure access keys are rotated every 90 days or less
requirement_description: An access key consists of an access key ID and a secret, which are used to sign programmatic requests that you make to Alibaba Cloud. RAM users need their own access keys to make programmatic calls to Alibaba Cloud from the Alibaba Cloud SDKs, CLIs, or direct HTTP/HTTPS calls using the APIs for individual Alibaba Cloud services. It is recommended that all access keys be regularly rotated.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy requires at least one uppercase letter
requirement_description: RAM password policies can be used to ensure password complexity. It is recommended that the password policy require at least one uppercase letter.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy requires at least one lowercase letter
requirement_description: RAM password policies can be used to ensure password complexity. It is recommended that the password policy require at least one lowercase letter.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy require at least one symbol
requirement_description: RAM password policies can be used to ensure password complexity. It is recommended that the password policy require at least one symbol.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy require at least one number
requirement_description: RAM password policies can be used to ensure password complexity. It is recommended that the password policy require at least one number.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy requires minimum length of 14 or greater
requirement_description: RAM password policies can be used to ensure password complexity. It is recommended that the password policy require a minimum of 14 or greater characters for any password.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy prevents password reuse
requirement_description: It is recommended that the password policy prevent the reuse of passwords.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy expires passwords in 365 days or greater
requirement_description: RAM password policies can require passwords to be expired after a given number of days. It is recommended that the password policy expire passwords after 365 days or greater.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM password policy temporarily blocks logon after 5 incorrect logon attempts within an hour
requirement_description: RAM password policies can temporarily block logon after several incorrect logon attempts within an hour. It is recommended that the password policy is set to temporarily block logon after 5 incorrect logon attempts within an hour.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM policies that allow full "*:*" administrative privileges are not created
requirement_description: RAM policies represent permissions that can be granted to users, groups, or roles. It is recommended and considered a standard security advice to grant least privilegethat is, granting only the permissions required to perform tasks. Determine what users need to do and then create policies with permissions only fits those tasks, instead of allowing full administrative privileges.

requirement_name: Ensure RAM policies are attached only to groups or roles
requirement_description: By default, RAM users, groups, and roles have no access to Alibaba Cloud resources. RAM policies are the means by which privileges are granted to users, groups, or roles. It is recommended that RAM policies be applied directly to groups and roles but not users.

requirement_name: Ensure Cloud Firewall access and security log analysis is enabled
requirement_description: Log Service collects log entries of internet traffic that are protected by Cloud Firewall, and supports real-time log query and analysis. The query results are centrally displayed in dashboards.

requirement_name: Ensure Security Center Network, Host and Security log analysis is enabled
requirement_description: Log Service collects log entries of Security Center for security logs, network logs, and host logs, with 14 subtypes, including 1. Security logs a. Vulnerability logs b. Baseline logs c. Security alerting logs 2. Security logs a. Vulnerability logs b. Baseline logs c. Security alerting logs 3. Network logs a. DNS logs b. Local DNS logs c. Network session logs d. Web logs 4. Server logs a. Process initiation logs b. Network connection logs c. System logon logs d. Brute-force cracking logs e. Process snapshots f. Account snapshots g. Port listening snapshots The Log Service supports real-time log query and analysis over the logs mentioned above. The query results are centrally displayed in dashboards.

requirement_name: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for RAM Role changes
requirement_description: It is recommended that a query and alarm should be established for RAM Role creation, deletion and updating activities.

requirement_name: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for Cloud Firewall changes
requirement_description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for Cloud Firewall rule changes.

requirement_name: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for VPC network route changes
requirement_description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for VPC network route changes.

requirement_name: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for VPC changes
requirement_description: It is recommended that a log search/analysis query and alarm be established for VPC changes.

requirement_name: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for OSS permission changes
requirement_description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for OSS Bucket RAM changes.

requirement_name: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for RDS instance configuration changes
requirement_description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for RDS Instance configuration changes.

requirement_name: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for unauthorized API calls
requirement_description: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing ActionTrail Logs to LogService and establishing corresponding query and alarms. It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for unauthorized API calls.

requirement_name: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for Management Console sign-in without MFA
requirement_description: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing ActionTrail Logs to Log Service and establishing corresponding query and alarms. It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for console logins that are not protected by multi-factor authentication (MFA).

requirement_name: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for usage of "root" account
requirement_description: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing ActionTrail Logs to Log Service and establishing corresponding query and alarms. It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for console logins that are not protected by root login attempts.

requirement_name: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for Management Console authentication failures
requirement_description: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing ActionTrail Logs to Log Service and establishing corresponding query and alarms. It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for failed console authentication attempts.

requirement_name: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for disabling or deletion of customer created CMKs
requirement_description: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing ActionTrail Logs to Log Service and establishing corresponding query and alarms. It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for customer created KMSs which have changed state to disabled or deletion.

requirement_name: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for OSS bucket policy changes
requirement_description: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing ActionTrail Logs to Log Service and establishing corresponding query and alarms. It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for changes to OSS bucket policies.

requirement_name: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for security group changes
requirement_description: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing ActionTrail Logs to Log Service and establishing corresponding query and alarms. Security Groups are a stateful packet filter that controls ingress and egress traffic within a VPC. It is recommended that a query and alarm be established changes to Security Groups.

requirement_name: Ensure that Logstore data retention period is set 365 days or greater
requirement_description: Ensure Activity Log Retention is set for 365 days or greater

requirement_name: Ensure legacy networks does not exist
requirement_description: In order to prevent use of legacy networks, ECS instances should not have a legacy network configured.

requirement_name: Ensure that SSH access is restricted from the internet
requirement_description: Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress/egress network traffic to Alibaba Cloud resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to port 22 or port 3389.

requirement_name: Ensure VPC flow logging is enabled in all VPCs
requirement_description: You can use the flow log function to monitor the IP traffic information for an ENI, a VSwitch or a VPC. If you create a flow log for a VSwitch or a VPC, all the Elastic Network Interfaces, including the newly created Elastic Network Interfaces, are monitored. Such flow log data is stored in Log Service, where you can view and analyze IP traffic information. It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet "Rejects" for VPCs.

requirement_name: Ensure routing tables for VPC peering are "least access"
requirement_description: Once a VPC peering connection is established, routing tables must be updated to establish any connections between the peered VPCs. These routes can be as specific as desired, even peering a VPC to only a single host on the other side of the connection.

requirement_name: Ensure the security group are configured with fine grained rules
requirement_description: Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress/egress network traffic to Alibaba Cloud resources. It is recommended that all security group configured with fine grained rules.

requirement_name: Ensure that 'Unattached disks' are encrypted
requirement_description: Ensure that unattached disks in a subscription are encrypted.

requirement_name: Ensure that Virtual Machines disk are encrypted
requirement_description: Ensure that disk are encrypted when it is created with the creation of VM instance.

requirement_name: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22
requirement_description: Security groups provide stateful filtering of ingress/egress network traffic to Alibaba Cloud resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to port 22.

requirement_name: Ensure no security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 3389
requirement_description: Security groups provide filtering of ingress/egress network traffic to Aliyun resources. It is recommended that no security group allows unrestricted ingress access to port 3389.

requirement_name: Ensure that the latest OS Patches for all Virtual Machines are applied
requirement_description: Ensure that the latest OS patches for all virtual machines are applied.

requirement_name: Ensure that the endpoint protection for all Virtual Machines is installed
requirement_description: Install endpoint protection for all virtual machines.

requirement_name: Ensure that OSS bucket is not anonymously or publicly accessible
requirement_description: A bucket is a container used to store objects in Object Storage Service (OSS). All objects in OSS are stored in buckets. It is recommended that the access policy on OSS bucket does not allows anonymous and/or public access.

requirement_name: Ensure that there are no publicly accessible objects in storage buckets
requirement_description: A bucket is a container used to store objects in Object Storage Service (OSS). All objects in OSS are stored in buckets. It is recommended that storage object ACL should not grant public access.

requirement_name: Ensure that logging is enabled for OSS buckets
requirement_description: OSS Bucket Access Logging generates a log that contains access records for each request made to your OSS bucket. An access log record contains details about the request, such as the request type, the resources specified in the request worked, and the time and date the request was processed. It is recommended that bucket access logging be enabled on the OSS bucket.

requirement_name: Ensure that 'Secure transfer required' is set to 'Enabled'
requirement_description: Enable the data encryption in transit.

requirement_name: Ensure that the shared URL signature expires within an hour
requirement_description: Expire the shared URL signature within an hour.

requirement_name: Ensure that URL signature is allowed only over https
requirement_description: URL signature is a URL that grants access rights to OSS. You can add signature information to a URL so that you can forward the URL to the third party for authorized access.A URL signature can be provided to the third party for authorized access.

requirement_name: Ensure network access rule for storage bucket is not set to publicly accessible
requirement_description: Restricting default network access helps to provide a new layer of security, since OSS accept connections from clients on any network. To limit access to selected networks, the default action must be changed.

requirement_name: Ensure server-side encryption is set to Encrypt with Service Key
requirement_description: Enable server-side encryption (Encrypt with Service Key) for objects.

requirement_name: Ensure server-side encryption is set to Encrypt with BYOK
requirement_description: Enable server-side encryption (Encrypt with BYOK) for objects.

requirement_name: Ensure that RDS instance requires all incoming connections to use SSL
requirement_description: It is recommended to enforce all incoming connections to SQL database instance to use SSL.

requirement_name: Ensure that RDS Instances are not open to the world
requirement_description: Database Server should accept connections only from trusted Network(s)/IP(s) and restrict access from the world.

requirement_name: Ensure that 'Auditing' is set to 'On' for applicable database instances
requirement_description: Enable SQL auditing on all RDS except SQL Server 2012/2016/2017 and MariaDB TX.

requirement_name: Ensure that 'Auditing' Retention is 'greater than 6 months'
requirement_description: Database SQL Audit Retention should be configured to be greater than 90 days.

requirement_name: Ensure that 'TDE' is set to 'Enabled' on for applicable database instance
requirement_description: Enable Transparent Data Encryption on every RDS instance.

requirement_name: Ensure RDS instance TDE protector is encrypted with BYOK (Use your own key)
requirement_description: TDE with BYOK support provides increased transparency and control, increased security with an HSM-backed KMS service, and promotion of separation of duties. With TDE, data is encrypted at rest with a symmetric key (called the database encryption key). With BYOK support for TDE, the DEK can be protected with an asymmetric key that is stored in the KMS. Based on business needs or criticality of data, it is recommended that the TDE protector is encrypted by a key that is managed by the data owner (BYOK).

requirement_name: Ensure parameter 'log_connections' is set to 'ON' for PostgreSQL Database
requirement_description: Enable log_connections on PostgreSQL Servers.

requirement_name: Ensure server parameter 'log_disconnections' is set to 'ON' for PostgreSQL Database Server
requirement_description: Enable log_disconnections on PostgreSQL Servers.

requirement_name: Ensure server parameter 'log_duration is set to 'ON' for PostgreSQL Database Server
requirement_description: Enable log_duration on PostgreSQL Servers.

requirement_name: Ensure Log Service is set to Enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
requirement_description: Log Service is a complete real-time data logging service on Alibaba Cloud to support collection, shipping, search, storage and analysis for logs. It includes a user interface to call the Log Viewer and an API to management logs pragmatically. Log Service could automatically collect, process, and store your container and audit logs in a dedicated, persistent datastore. Container logs are collected from your containers. Audit logs are collected from the kube-apiserver or the deployed ingress. Events are logs about activity in the cluster, such as the deleting of Pods or Secrets.

requirement_name: Ensure CloudMonitor is set to Enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
requirement_description: The monitoring service in Kubernetes Engine clusters depends on the Alibaba Cloud CloudMonitor agent to access additional system resources and application services in virtual machine instances. The monitor can access metrics about CPU utilization, some disk traffic metrics, network traffic, and disk IO information, which help to monitor signals and build operations in your Kubernetes Engine clusters.

requirement_name: Ensure role-based access control (RBAC) authorization is Enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
requirement_description: In Kubernetes, authorizers interact by granting a permission if any authorizer grants the permission. The legacy authorizer in Kubernetes Engine grants broad, statically defined permissions. To ensure that RBAC limits permissions correctly, you must disable the legacy authorizer. RBAC has significant security advantages, can help you ensure that users only have access to specific cluster resources within their own namespace and is now stable in Kubernetes.

requirement_name: Ensure Cluster Check triggered at least once per week for Kubernetes Clusters
requirement_description: Kubernetes Engine's cluster check feature helps you verify the system nodes and components healthy status. When you trigger the checking, the process would check on the health state of each node in your cluster and also the cluster configuration as kubelet\docker daemon\kernel and network iptables configuration, if there are fails consecutive health checks, the diagnose would report to admin for further repair.

requirement_name: Ensure Kubernetes web UI / Dashboard is not enabled
requirement_description: Dashboard is a web-based Kubernetes user interface. It can be used to deploy containerized applications to a Kubernetes cluster, troubleshoot your containerized application, and manage the cluster itself along with its attendant resources. You can use Dashboard to get an overview of applications running on your cluster, as well as for creating or modifying individual Kubernetes resources (such as Deployments, Jobs, DaemonSets, etc). For example, you can scale a Deployment, initiate a rolling update, restart a pod or deploy new applications using a deploy wizard.

requirement_name: Ensure Basic Authentication is not enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
requirement_description: Basic authentication allows a user to authenticate to the cluster with a username and password and it is stored in plain text without any encryption. Disabling Basic authentication will prevent attacks like brute force. Its recommended to use either client certificate or RAM for authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure Network policy is enabled on Kubernetes Engine Clusters
requirement_description: A network policy is a specification of how groups of pods are allowed to communicate with each other and other network endpoints. NetworkPolicy resources use labels to select pods and define rules which specify what traffic is allowed to the selected pods. The Kubernetes Network Policy API allows the cluster administrator to specify what pods are allowed to communicate with each other.

requirement_name: Ensure ENI multiple IP mode support for Kubernetes Cluster
requirement_description: Alibaba Cloud ENI (Elastic Network Interface) has supported assign ranges of internal IP addresses as aliases to a single virtual machine's ENI network interfaces. This is useful if you have lots of services running on a VM and you want to assign each service a different IP address without quota limitation.

requirement_name: Ensure Kubernetes Cluster is created with Private cluster enabled
requirement_description: A private cluster is a cluster that makes your master inaccessible from the public internet. In a private cluster, nodes do not have public IP addresses, so your workloads run in an environment that is isolated from the internet. Nodes have addresses only in the private address space. Nodes and masters communicate with each other privately using VPC peering.

requirement_name: Ensure that Security Center is Advanced or Enterprise Edition
requirement_description: The Advanced or Enterprise Edition enables threat detection for network and endpoints, providing malware detection, webshell detection and anomaly detection in Security Center.

requirement_name: Ensure that all assets are installed with security agent
requirement_description: Enable protection on all endpoints.

requirement_name: Ensure that Automatic Quarantine is enabled
requirement_description: Enable automatic quarantine in Security Center may 1ncure additional cost.

requirement_name: Ensure that Webshell detection is enabled on all web servers
requirement_description: Enable webshell detection on all web servers to scans periodically the Web directories for detecting webshells on servers.

requirement_name: Ensure that notification is enabled on all high risk items
requirement_description: Enable all risk item notification in Vulnerability, Baseline Risks, Alerts and Accesskey Leak event detection categories.

requirement_name: Ensure that Config Assessment is granted with privilege
requirement_description: Grant Security Centers Cloud Platform Configuration Assessment the privilege to access other cloud product.

requirement_name: Ensure that scheduled vulnerability scan is enabled on all servers
requirement_description: Ensure that scheduled vulnerability scan is enabled on all servers.

requirement_name: Ensure that Asset Fingerprint automatically collects asset fingerprint data
requirement_description: The Enterprise Edition enables asset fingerprint collection for endpoints providing a collection of port, software, processes, scheduled tasks and middleware in Security Center.

requirement_name: Ensure that the API server pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the API server pod specification file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the API server pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the API server pod specification file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the controller manager pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the controller manager pod specification file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the controller manager pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the controller manager pod specification file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the scheduler pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the scheduler pod specification file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the scheduler pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the scheduler pod specification file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the etcd pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the etcd pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the Container Network Interface file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the Container Network Interface files have permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the Container Network Interface file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the Container Network Interface files have ownership set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the etcd data directory permissions are set to 700 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the etcd data directory has permissions of 700 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the etcd data directory ownership is set to etcd:etcd
requirement_description: Ensure that the etcd data directory ownership is set to etcd:etcd .

requirement_name: Ensure that the admin.conf file permissions are set to 600
requirement_description: Ensure that the admin.conf file has permissions of 600 .

requirement_name: Ensure that the admin.conf file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the admin.conf file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the scheduler.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the scheduler.conf file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the scheduler.conf file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the scheduler.conf file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the controller-manager.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the controller-manager.conf file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the controller-manager.conf file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the controller-manager.conf file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI directory and file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI directory and file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI certificate file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that Kubernetes PKI certificate files have permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI key file permissions are set to 600
requirement_description: Ensure that Kubernetes PKI key files have permissions of 600 .

requirement_name: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable anonymous requests to the API server.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --token-auth-file parameter is not set
requirement_description: Do not use token based authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --DenyServiceExternalIPs is not set
requirement_description: This admission controller rejects all net-new usage of the Service field externalIPs.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: Enable certificate based kubelet authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Verify kubelet's certificate before establishing connection.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
requirement_description: Do not always authorize all requests.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes Node
requirement_description: Restrict kubelet nodes to reading only objects associated with them.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC
requirement_description: Turn on Role Based Access Control.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set
requirement_description: Limit the rate at which the API server accepts requests.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysAdmit is not set
requirement_description: Do not allow all requests.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set
requirement_description: Always pull images.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used
requirement_description: The SecurityContextDeny admission controller can be used to deny pods which make use of some SecurityContext fields which could allow for privilege escalation in the cluster. This should be used where PodSecurityPolicy is not in place within the cluster.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set
requirement_description: Automate service accounts management.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set
requirement_description: Reject creating objects in a namespace that is undergoing termination.

requirement_name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set
requirement_description: Limit the Node and Pod objects that a kubelet could modify.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --secure-port argument is not set to 0
requirement_description: Do not disable the secure port.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-path argument is set
requirement_description: Enable auditing on the Kubernetes API Server and set the desired audit log path.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxage argument is set to 30 or as appropriate
requirement_description: Retain the logs for at least 30 days or as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxbackup argument is set to 10 or as appropriate
requirement_description: Retain 10 or an appropriate number of old log files.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxsize argument is set to 100 or as appropriate
requirement_description: Rotate log files on reaching 100 MB or as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --request-timeout argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Set global request timeout for API server requests as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --service-account-lookup argument is set to true
requirement_description: Validate service account before validating token.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --service-account-key-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Explicitly set a service account public key file for service accounts on the apiserver.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --etcd-certfile and --etcd-keyfile arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --etcd-cafile argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --encryption-provider-config argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Encrypt etcd key-value store.

requirement_name: Ensure that encryption providers are appropriately configured
requirement_description: Where etcd encryption is used, appropriate providers should be configured.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --terminated-pod-gc-threshold argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Activate garbage collector on pod termination, as appropriate.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --use-service-account-credentials argument is set to true
requirement_description: Use individual service account credentials for each controller.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --service-account-private-key-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Explicitly set a service account private key file for service accounts on the controller manager.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Allow pods to verify the API server's serving certificate before establishing connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
requirement_description: Enable kubelet server certificate rotation on controller-manager.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
requirement_description: Do not bind the Controller Manager service to non-loopback insecure addresses.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
requirement_description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --cert-file and --key-file arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: Configure TLS encryption for the etcd service.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --client-cert-auth argument is set to true
requirement_description: Enable client authentication on etcd service.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --auto-tls argument is not set to true
requirement_description: Do not use self-signed certificates for TLS.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --peer-cert-file and --peer-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for peer connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --peer-client-cert-auth argument is set to true
requirement_description: etcd should be configured for peer authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --peer-auto-tls argument is not set to true
requirement_description: Do not use automatically generated self-signed certificates for TLS connections between peers.

requirement_name: Ensure that a unique Certificate Authority is used for etcd
requirement_description: Use a different certificate authority for etcd from the one used for Kubernetes.

requirement_name: Ensure that a unique Certificate Authority is used for etcd
requirement_description: Use a different certificate authority for etcd from the one used for Kubernetes.

requirement_name: Client certificate authentication should not be used for users
requirement_description: Kubernetes provides the option to use client certificates for user authentication. However as there is no way to revoke these certificates when a user leaves an organization or loses their credential, they are not suitable for this purpose. It is not possible to fully disable client certificate use within a cluster as it is used for component to component authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --basic-auth-file argument is not set
requirement_description: Do not use basic authentication.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --insecure-allow-any-token argument is not set
requirement_description: Do not allow any insecure tokens.

requirement_name: Ensure that a minimal audit policy is created
requirement_description: Kubernetes can audit the details of requests made to the API server. The --audit- policy-file flag must be set for this logging to be enabled.

requirement_name: Ensure that the audit policy covers key security concerns
requirement_description: Ensure that the audit policy created for the cluster covers key security concerns.

requirement_name: Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet service file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: If kube-proxy is running, and if it is using a file-based kubeconfig file, ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: If kube-proxy is running, ensure that the file ownership of its kubeconfig file is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: Ensure that the certificate authorities file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root .

requirement_name: If the kubelet config.yaml configuration file is being used validate permissions set to 600 or more restrictive
requirement_description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive.

requirement_name: If the kubelet config.yaml configuration file is being used validate file ownership is set to root:root
requirement_description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file is owned by root:root.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
requirement_description: Disable anonymous requests to the Kubelet server.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
requirement_description: Do not allow all requests. Enable explicit authorization.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
requirement_description: Enable Kubelet authentication using certificates.

requirement_name: Verify that the --read-only-port argument is set to 0
requirement_description: Disable the read-only port.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --streaming-connection-idle-timeout argument is not set to 0
requirement_description: Do not disable timeouts on streaming connections.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --protect-kernel-defaults argument is set to true
requirement_description: Protect tuned kernel parameters from overriding kubelet default kernel parameter values.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --make-iptables-util-chains argument is set to true
requirement_description: Allow Kubelet to manage iptables.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --hostname-override argument is not set
requirement_description: Do not override node hostnames.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --event-qps argument is set to 0 or a level which ensures appropriate event capture
requirement_description: Security relevant information should be captured. The --event-qps flag on the Kubelet can be used to limit the rate at which events are gathered. Setting this too low could result in relevant events not being logged, however the unlimited setting of 0 could result in a denial of service on the kubelet.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
requirement_description: Setup TLS connection on the Kubelets.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --rotate-certificates argument is not set to false
requirement_description: Enable kubelet client certificate rotation.

requirement_name: Verify that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
requirement_description: Enable kubelet server certificate rotation.

requirement_name: Ensure that the Kubelet only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers
requirement_description: Ensure that the Kubelet is configured to only use strong cryptographic ciphers.

requirement_name: Ensure that the --seccomp-default parameter is set to true
requirement_description: Ensure that the Kubelet enforces the use of the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile

requirement_name: Ensure that the --IPAddressDeny is set to any
requirement_description: Ensuring that --IPAddressDeny is set to "Any" will facilitate allowlisting of only IP addresses that are explicitly set with the --IPAddressAllow parameter which will block unspecified IP addresses from communicating with the kubelet component.

requirement_name: Ensure that the kube-proxy metrics service is bound to localhost
requirement_description: Do not bind the kube-proxy metrics port to non-loopback addresses.

requirement_name: Ensure that the cluster-admin role is only used where required
requirement_description: The RBAC role cluster-admin provides wide-ranging powers over the environment and should be used only where and when needed.

requirement_name: Minimize access to secrets
requirement_description: The Kubernetes API stores secrets, which may be service account tokens for the Kubernetes API or credentials used by workloads in the cluster. Access to these secrets should be restricted to the smallest possible group of users to reduce the risk of privilege escalation.

requirement_name: Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles
requirement_description: Kubernetes Roles and ClusterRoles provide access to resources based on sets of objects and actions that can be taken on those objects. It is possible to set either of these to be the wildcard "*" which matches all items. Use of wildcards is not optimal from a security perspective as it may allow for inadvertent access to be granted when new resources are added to the Kubernetes API either as CRDs or in later versions of the product.

requirement_name: Minimize access to create pods
requirement_description: The ability to create pods in a namespace can provide a number of opportunities for privilege escalation, such as assigning privileged service accounts to these pods or mounting hostPaths with access to sensitive data (unless Pod Security Policies are implemented to restrict this access) As such, access to create new pods should be restricted to the smallest possible group of users.

requirement_name: Ensure that default service accounts are not actively used.
requirement_description: The default service account should not be used to ensure that rights granted to applications can be more easily audited and reviewed.

requirement_name: Ensure that Service Account Tokens are only mounted where necessary
requirement_description: Service accounts tokens should not be mounted in pods except where the workload running in the pod explicitly needs to communicate with the API server

requirement_name: Avoid use of system:masters group
requirement_description: The special group system:masters should not be used to grant permissions to any user or service account, except where strictly necessary (e.g. bootstrapping access prior to RBAC being fully available)

requirement_name: Limit use of the Bind, Impersonate and Escalate permissions in the Kubernetes cluster
requirement_description: Cluster roles and roles with the impersonate, bind or escalate permissions should not be granted unless strictly required. Each of these permissions allow a particular subject to escalate their privileges beyond those explicitly granted by cluster administrators

requirement_name: Minimize access to create persistent volumes
requirement_description: The ability to create persistent volumes in a cluster can provide an opportunity for privilege escalation, via the creation of hostPath volumes. As persistent volumes are not covered by Pod Security Admission, a user with access to create persistent volumes may be able to get access to sensitive files from the underlying host even where restrictive Pod Security Admission policies are in place.

requirement_name: Minimize access to the proxy sub-resource of nodes
requirement_description: Users with access to the Proxy sub-resource of Node objects automatically have permissions to use the kubelet API, which may allow for privilege escalation or bypass cluster security controls such as audit logs. The kubelet provides an API which includes rights to execute commands in any container running on the node. Access to this API is covered by permissions to the main Kubernetes API via the node object. The proxy sub-resource specifically allows wide ranging access to the kubelet API. Direct access to the kubelet API bypasses controls like audit logging (there is no audit log of kubelet API access) and admission control.

requirement_name: Minimize access to the approval sub-resource of certificatesigningrequests objects
requirement_description: Users with access to the update the approval sub-resource of CertificateSigningRequests objects can approve new client certificates for the Kubernetes API effectively allowing them to create new high-privileged user accounts. This can allow for privilege escalation to full cluster administrator, depending on users configured in the cluster

requirement_name: Minimize access to webhook configuration objects
requirement_description: Users with rights to create/modify/delete validatingwebhookconfigurations or mutatingwebhookconfigurations can control webhooks that can read any object admitted to the cluster, and in the case of mutating webhooks, also mutate admitted objects. This could allow for privilege escalation or disruption of the operation of the cluster.

requirement_name: Minimize access to the service account token creation
requirement_description: Users with rights to create new service account tokens at a cluster level, can create long-lived privileged credentials in the cluster. This could allow for privilege escalation and persistent access to the cluster, even if the users account has been revoked.

requirement_name: Ensure that the cluster has at least one active policy control mechanism in place
requirement_description: Every Kubernetes cluster should have at least one policy control mechanism in place to enforce the other requirements in this section. This could be the in-built Pod Security Admission controller, or a third party policy control system.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of privileged containers
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the securityContext.privileged flag set to true .

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostPID flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host IPC namespace
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostIPC flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host network namespace
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the hostNetwork flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run with the allowPrivilegeEscalation flag set to true. Allowing this right can lead to a process running a container getting more rights than it started with. It's important to note that these rights are still constrained by the overall container sandbox, and this setting does not relate to the use of privileged containers.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of root containers
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers to be run as the root user.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with the NET_RAW capability
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers with the potentially dangerous NET_RAW capability.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with added capabilities
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers with capabilities assigned beyond the default set.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers with capabilities

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of Windows HostProcess Containers
requirement_description: Do not generally permit Windows containers to be run with the hostProcess flag set to true.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of HostPath volumes
requirement_description: Do not generally admit containers which make use of hostPath volumes.

requirement_name: Minimize the admission of containers which use HostPorts
requirement_description: Do not generally permit containers which require the use of HostPorts.

requirement_name: Ensure that the CNI in use supports Network Policies
requirement_description: There are a variety of CNI plugins available for Kubernetes. If the CNI in use does not support Network Policies it may not be possible to effectively restrict traffic in the cluster.

requirement_name: Ensure that all Namespaces have Network Policies defined
requirement_description: Use network policies to isolate traffic in your cluster network.

requirement_name: Prefer using secrets as files over secrets as environment variables
requirement_description: Kubernetes supports mounting secrets as data volumes or as environment variables. Minimize the use of environment variable secrets.

requirement_name: Consider external secret storage
requirement_description: Consider the use of an external secrets storage and management system, instead of using Kubernetes Secrets directly, if you have more complex secret management needs. Ensure the solution requires authentication to access secrets, has auditing of access to and use of secrets, and encrypts secrets. Some solutions also make it easier to rotate secrets.

requirement_name: Configure Image Provenance using ImagePolicyWebhook admission controller
requirement_description: Configure Image Provenance for your deployment.

requirement_name: Create administrative boundaries between resources using namespaces
requirement_description: Use namespaces to isolate your Kubernetes objects.

requirement_name: Ensure that the seccomp profile is set to docker/default in your pod definitions
requirement_description: Enable docker/default seccomp profile in your pod definitions.

requirement_name: Apply Security Context to Your Pods and Containers
requirement_description: Apply Security Context to Your Pods and Containers

requirement_name: The default namespace should not be used
requirement_description: Kubernetes provides a default namespace, where objects are placed if no namespace is specified for them. Placing objects in this namespace makes application of RBAC and other controls more difficult.

requirement_name: Ensure that the API Server only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers
requirement_description: Ensure that the API server is configured to only use strong cryptographic ciphers.
